article.title: A multi-wavelength study of nearby millisecond pulsar PSR J1400$-$1431: improved astrometry & an optical detection of its cool white dwarf companion

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the approximate difference in timing residuals between the 350 MHz and 820 MHz observations for PSR J1400-1431 over the five-year period?
This figure shows the integrated profiles of PSR J1400-1431 at different observing frequencies. What trend is generally observed in the pulse profile with increasing frequency?
choices: The pulse profile shows no significant change.
The pulse profile exhibits a double peak structure at higher frequencies.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the most probable distance to PSR J1400-1431 based on the combined analysis of parallax, Shklovskii effect, and the Lutz-Kelker bias?
This formula describes the amplitude of the timing parallax signature. According to this formula, a pulsar with a larger ecliptic latitude will exhibit:
choices: The parallax signature is independent of ecliptic latitude.
